trans-unit.source: Provides the abstract base class for creating formats that can be applied to a custom Web server control at design time.

DesignerAutoFormat provides a base class that can be inherited from and extended to display a formatted custom Web server control at design time in a visual designer tool such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
A control developer provides automatic formatting in order to help developers who use the control to select a preferred display.
A custom DesignerAutoFormat object works with a custom control designer to provide automatic formatting at design time for a custom control.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control provides a variety of formats that can be applied by a developer at design time.
To implement automatic formatting for a custom control: 1.
Create the custom control.

Derive a designer class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class or another designer class that is appropriate for your control, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TextControlDesigner>.
Derive a format class from the DesignerAutoFormat class that formats your custom control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Apply%2A> method.

In your designer class, populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property, which is a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object, with one instance of your format class for each named format that your designer can apply.

The DesignerAutoFormat class provides the following members to support automatic formatting at design time: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Apply%2A> method, which applies the named format to the specified control.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.GetPreviewControl%2A> method, which provides a copy of the control for previewing in an **AutoFormat** dialog box of a visual designer such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)].
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Name%2A> property, which provides the text to display in a list of formats in a visual designer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> class.

Use the DesignerAutoFormat constructor to create a new format and add it to a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> collection that is represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> object.
A string that identifies a specific <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> object.
name is .
Applies the associated formatting to the specified control.
The Apply method applies formatting to the specified control based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Name%2A> property.

You can apply the styles directly to the control, or set the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Style%2A> property and then use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.MergeStyle%2A> method for the control to apply the style changes to the control.
A Web server control to apply the formatting to.
Returns a copy of the associated control in order to provide a preview before applying the format to the control.

The GetPreviewControl method is used by visual designers, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], in an **AutoFormat** dialog box to display a formatted run-time preview of the control at design time before applying the format to the actual control.

Regardless of the setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> attribute for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> object, the GetPreviewControl method returns a copy of the control in the `runtimeControl` parameter.
A run-time version of the Web server control.
The GetPreviewControl method returns a copy of the associated Web server control.
Gets the name of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> object.

A visual designer, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], uses the Name property from each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> to create a list of available automatic style formats.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> name.

Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatStyle"></xref> object that is used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> object to render a design-time preview of the associated control.
Although the object returned by the Style property is read-only, each individual property that it contains can be set.

For example, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.ForeColor%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatStyle.VerticalAlign%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatStyle> object.
An object that is used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> object to render a design-time preview of the associated control.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref> object.
The ToString method returns a string that contains the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Name%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat.Name*> property of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat"></xref>.
